column4: Hello, I am looking for some help resizing my /root partition. I don't have enough room to update to 8.10. I tried using gparted via the 8.10 livecd but i could only shrink my /home partition. Even after this, when I had available space, I coudlnt figure out how to make / bigger
Any help would be greatly appreciated
you can't resize it while booted to it, try to do it from the LiveCD
I tried from the live cd
what error is it throwing when you try to shrink it?
I could shrink my /home partition without any problems and I applied it, which left me with available space.
Click 'n drag...
what program are you using to do your partitioning?
it doesn't
what filesystem is / using?
when you click on the partition and click grow/shrink... are you not able to drag it larger?
No, I cannot make it larger
does it show that there is the possibility to make it larger?
No, it doesn't. I have SDA1, which is my /root
nope....

it should show that there is some empty space (grey) on either side of the coloured (blue?) root partition... if there is no grey (empty space) adjacent to the partition, there is nowhere to expand to.
I don't know why there wouldn't be any space showing, though. I just shrunk my /home partition by 5 gigs
Did you click apply?
Can you provide a screenshot? it might be able to help. It's ok if you can't.
Perhaps I should retry with the LiveCD?
that should work.... I'm just re-installing GParted so I can take a look for you and give you some more help.
